io.klerch.alexa.state.handler

Interface AlexaStateHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlexaSessionStateHandler, AWSDynamoStateHandler, AWSIotStateHandler, AWSS3StateHandler

    public interface AlexaStateHandler
    A state handler is an object which encapsulates persistence logic of your model states It comes in multiple flavours where each of the implementation is dedicated to a persistence store.

    • Method Detail

      • getSession

        com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session getSession()
        Returns the Alexa Session object which was given to this handler. This is where state of all models are written to and read from.
        Returns:
        Alexa Session object

      • getAttributeKey

        <TModel extends AlexaStateModel> String getAttributeKey(Class<TModel> modelClass)
        Returns the key used to save the model in the session attributes. This method doesn't take an id thus will return the key for the singleton object of the model.
        Type Parameters:
        TModel - The model type derived from AlexaStateModel.
        Parameters:
        modelClass - The type of an AlexaStateModel.
        Returns:
        key used to save the model in the session attributes

      • getAttributeKey

        <TModel extends AlexaStateModel> String getAttributeKey(Class<TModel> modelClass,
                                                        String id)
        Returns the key used to save the model in the session attributes. This method takes an id thus will return the key for a specific instance of the model as many of them can exist in your session.
        Type Parameters:
        TModel - The model type derived from AlexaStateModel.
        Parameters:
        modelClass - The type of an AlexaStateModel.
        id - the key for a specific instance of the model
        Returns:
        key used to save the model in the session attributes

      • getAttributeKey

        String getAttributeKey(AlexaStateModel model)
        Returns the key used to save the model in the session attributes. This method obtains an id from the given model thus will return the key for a specific instance of the model as many of them can exist in your session. If given model does not provide an id it will return the key for the singleton object of the model.
        Parameters:
        model - the model to save in the session
        Returns:
        key used to save the model in the session attributes

      • createModel

        <TModel extends AlexaStateModel> TModel createModel(Class<TModel> modelClass)
        Creates an instance of your model class and binds it to this handler. Thus you can manage state directly on or in your model without referencing the handler anymore (e.g. AlexaStateModel.saveState() or AlexaStateModel.removeState()) This really much does the same as what you can achieve with AlexaStateModelFactory.createModel(Class, AlexaStateHandler). Of course you can initialize your models with its own constructor but make sure you setHandler() before calling aforementioned methods of this model. By using this method you are not assigning an id to the model. Your model behaves like a singleton within its AlexaScope (Session, User or Application) and is overridden on AlexaStateModel.saveState() if already existent.
        Type Parameters:
        TModel - type derived from AlexaStateModel
        Parameters:
        modelClass - type of your model you want to initialize. Model has to derive from AlexaStateModel
        Returns:
        Fresh instance of a model

      • createModel

        <TModel extends AlexaStateModel> TModel createModel(Class<TModel> modelClass,
                                                    String id)
        Creates an instance of your model class and binds it to this handler. Thus you can manage state directly on or in your model without referencing the handler anymore (e.g. AlexaStateModel.saveState() or AlexaStateModel.removeState()) This really much does the same as what you can achieve with AlexaStateModelFactory.createModel(Class, AlexaStateHandler). Of course you can initialize your models with its own constructor but make sure you AlexaStateModel.setHandler(AlexaStateHandler) before calling aforementioned methods of this model. By using this method you will assign an id to the model. From now on this id is used to read and write to the persistence store associated with the handler. It gives you freedom to have more than one of a kind of your model within its AlexaScope (Session, User, Application)
        Type Parameters:
        TModel - type derived from AlexaStateModel
        Parameters:
        modelClass - type of your model you want to initialize. Model has to derive from AlexaStateModel
        id - An id unique within a model's AlexaScope. If a model with this id is already existing in the persistence store it will be overridden on AlexaStateModel.saveState().
        Returns:
        Fresh instance of a model

      • writeModel

        void writeModel(AlexaStateModel model)
         throws AlexaStateException
        The given model will be saved in the persistence store according to its AlexaStateSave-annotations. If you set up an Id for the model it will be accessible with it on later on reads to the handler.
        Parameters:
        model - Your model which needs to be a type of AlexaStateModel
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • removeModel

        void removeModel(AlexaStateModel model)
          throws AlexaStateException
        The given model will be removed from the persistence store. If it's not existing in the store nothing happens. Be aware of the Id set in the model as the removal will only affect the model with this id.
        Parameters:
        model - Your model which needs to be a type of AlexaStateModel
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • readModel

        <TModel extends AlexaStateModel> Optional<TModel> readModel(Class<TModel> modelClass)
                                                     throws AlexaStateException
        Reads out the model from the persistence store of this handler. Depending on the AlexaScopes configured in the AlexaStateSave annotations it will possibly collect data from more than one persistence store. (most likely from the Alexa session and maybe from the permanent persistence store associated with this handler. You are not providing an id with this call. Thus it will look for the single representative without an id.
        Type Parameters:
        TModel - Type derived from AlexaStateModel
        Parameters:
        modelClass - Type of the model you would like to read out. It needs to be of type AlexaStateModel.
        Returns:
        A model matching the given type and augmented with all the attributes found in the persistence store.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model

      • readModel

        <TModel extends AlexaStateModel> Optional<TModel> readModel(Class<TModel> modelClass,
                                                            String id)
                                                     throws AlexaStateException
        Reads out the model from the persistence store of this handler. Depending on the AlexaScopes configured in the AlexaStateSave annotations it will possibly collect data from more than one persistence store. (most likely from the Alexa session and maybe from the permanent persistence store associated with this handler. You are providing an id with this call. If you never saved the model with this id in the store you won't get anything.
        Type Parameters:
        TModel - Type derived from AlexaStateModel
        Parameters:
        modelClass - Type of the model you would like to read out. It needs to be of type AlexaStateModel.
        id - The id of an existing instance of your model in the persistence store.
        Returns:
        A model matching the given type and id. Augmented with all the attributes found in the persistence store.
        Throws:
        AlexaStateException - Wraps all inner exceptions and gives you context related to handler and model
